acceptAdmin(address,(uint64,bytes[],byte.details: Can only be called if this contract is the pending owner for the token.

params.chainsToAdd: The chains to add to the token pool

applyAddChain((uint64,bytes[],bytes,(boo.details: Requires the token pool to be set

applyAdminTransfer(address).details: Transfers admin on the TokenPool and ownership on the ZCHF token on the TokenAdminRegistry

params.newAdmin: The address of the new admin

applyRateLimit(uint64,(bool,uint128,uint.details: Requires the token pool to be set

params.chain: The chain to set the rate limits for
params.helpers: Array of helper addresses for qualification check

applyRemotePoolUpdate((bool,uint64,bytes.details: Requires the token pool to be set

applyRemoveChain(uint64).details: Requires the token pool to be set

deny(bytes32,address[]).details: Only qualified voters can deny proposals

params.hash: The hash of the proposal to deny
params.helpers: Array of helper addresses for qualification check

params.helpers: Array of helper addresses for qualification check

params.newAdmin: The address of the new admin

proposeRemotePoolUpdate((bool,uint64,byt.details: The contract only stores the hash. So the data has to be passed in during apply again

params.helpers: The helpers to get enough votes

proposeRemoveChain(uint64,address[]).details: The contract only stores the hash. So the data has to be passed in during apply again

params.helpers: Array of helper addresses for qualification check

registerToken(address,address,(uint64,by.details: Can only be called while the token admin is not set

params.chainsToAdd: The chains to add to the token pool
params.registry: The registry to register the token with

acceptAdmin(address,(uint64,bytes[],byte.notice: Accepts the admin role transfer on the TokenAdminRegistry and sets the token pool

applyRateLimit(uint64,(bool,uint128,uint.notice: Sets the rate limits for the given chain. Any qualified voter can apply rate limits with immediate effect.         Rate limits can only do limited harm, so it is acceptable to be very permissive. At the same time, rate limits are typically         applied during emergencies, e.g. when a chain has been hacked. Therefore, it is desirable to ensure that         they can be applied quickly.

applyRemotePoolUpdate((bool,uint64,bytes.notice: Applies the update on the TokenPool

deny(bytes32,address[]).notice: Denies and removes a pending proposal

proposeAddChain((uint64,bytes[],bytes,(b.notice: Propose to add a remote chains

proposeAdminTransfer(address,address[]).notice: Proposed a new admin for the TokenPool and Admin on the Token registry

proposeRemoveChain(uint64,address[]).notice: Propose to add or remove remote chains

registerToken(address,address,(uint64,by.notice: Registers the token in the CCIP system
